p: Piecewise linear regression revealed two statistically significant ( p < 0.05) upswings in the rate of virus discovery: in 1930 (95% confidence intervals (CIs) 1927–1933) and in 1954 (1952–1955). Since 1954 the mean rate of discovery has been 3.37 species per year with variance 3.35, consistent with a Poisson process. However, there has been a slight but statistically significant downward trend in the rate of discovery (a linear regression of (count per year) 0.5 against year has slope −0.010, 95% CIs −0.020 to 0.0, p = 0.049).
